faqPage.question: What is Radiance of the Seas?
faqPage.answer: Radiance of the Seas is a cruise ship operated by Royal Caribbean. It is the lead vessel of the Radiance class, known for its extensive use of glass, giving it a very open and airy feel with great ocean views.

faqPage.question: When was Radiance of the Seas built?
faqPage.answer: The ship was built in 2001. It was last refurbished in 2011 to add several new dining venues and other features.

faqPage.question: What is the passenger capacity of Radiance of the Seas?
faqPage.answer: The ship can carry 2,466 passengers at double occupancy and has a crew of 894.

faqPage.question: What are the ship's basic stats?
faqPage.answer: Radiance of the Seas has a gross tonnage of 90,090, is 962 feet long, and has 12 passenger decks.

faqPage.question: What makes the Radiance class unique?
faqPage.answer: The Radiance class was designed with the most glass of any Royal Caribbean fleet, featuring glass elevators with ocean views and a nine-story central atrium, maximizing natural light and scenic views.

faqPage.question: What itineraries does Radiance of the Seas typically sail?
faqPage.answer: It varies by season. The ship often sails one-way Alaska itineraries in the summer from Vancouver and cruises the Caribbean from Florida (like Tampa) or Puerto Rico in the winter.

faqPage.question: What complimentary dining options are on board?
faqPage.answer: Complimentary dining includes the main 'Cascades' dining room, the 'Windjammer Café' (buffet), 'Park Café' (for paninis and salads), and the 'Boardwalk Doghouse'.

faqPage.question: What specialty (extra cost) restaurants are available?
faqPage.answer: Specialty dining options include 'Chops Grille' (steakhouse), 'Giovanni's Table' (Italian), and 'Izumi' (Sushi and Hibachi).

faqPage.question: Is there a coffee shop on board?
faqPage.answer: Yes, 'Café Latte-tudes' serves Starbucks coffee and pastries. Note that Starbucks beverages are typically not included in the standard drink packages and cost extra.

faqPage.question: What are the main entertainment venues?
faqPage.answer: The 'Aurora Borealis Theatre' (seating 868) hosts Broadway and Vegas-style shows. Other venues include the 'Viking Crown Lounge' (observatory/disco), 'Starquest' (disco), 'Schooner Bar', and 'Casino Royale'.

faqPage.question: Is there an adults-only pool area?
faqPage.answer: Yes, the 'Solarium' is an adults-only pool area. It is fully covered by a glass roof, making it usable in all weather, including on cooler Alaska sailings.

faqPage.question: What activities are available on the ship?
faqPage.answer: Onboard activities include a rock-climbing wall, an outdoor pool, a spa, a fitness center, a casino, and an outdoor movie screen.

faqPage.question: Does Radiance of the Seas have solo cabins?
faqPage.answer: Yes, the ship was updated with three 'Studio Interior' staterooms (Category 2W). These cabins are sized for one person and allow solo cruisers to book without paying the single supplement.

faqPage.question: What kind of suites are available?
faqPage.answer: The ship offers a range of suites, including Junior Suites, Grand Suites, Owner's Suites, and a large Royal Suite that features a baby grand piano.

faqPage.question: Are there accessible staterooms?
faqPage.answer: Yes, Radiance of the Seas is equipped with 15 accessible staterooms designed for guests with mobility needs.

faqPage.question: Does the ship have a promenade deck?
faqPage.answer: Yes, it features a full-circle promenade deck that is shielded from the sun, making it a great place for walking or jogging.

faqPage.question: Are clothes irons or steamers allowed in cabins?
faqPage.answer: No. All items that generate heat, such as clothes irons, travel steamers, and hot plates, are prohibited and will be confiscated. Curling irons and hair straighteners are the only exception and are allowed.

faqPage.question: Are power strips allowed on board?
faqPage.answer: Officially, power strips are listed as prohibited items. Enforcement can be inconsistent. It is safer to bring a non-surge-protected multi-adapter to use the cabin's US and European-style outlets.

faqPage.question: What is the main dining room called?
faqPage.answer: The two-story main dining room is named 'Cascades'.

faqPage.question: Is Radiance of the Seas considered a large or small ship?
faqPage.answer: By modern standards, it is considered a mid-sized ship. It lacks the 'star attractions' of the giant Oasis-class ships (like the AquaTheater) but offers a less crowded, more traditional cruise experience.

faqPage.question: Is there a kids' club?
faqPage.answer: Yes, the ship has the 'Adventure Ocean' youth program, which provides supervised activities for children and teens in different age groups.

faqPage.question: What is the 'Viking Crown Lounge'?
faqPage.answer: It is a signature Royal Caribbean lounge located high up on the ship, offering panoramic 180-degree views from its floor-to-ceiling windows. It often functions as an observatory by day and a disco/lounge by night.

faqPage.question: Can I get room service?
faqPage.answer: Yes. A complimentary continental breakfast is available via room service. However, a 'hot' breakfast and all other room service orders outside of breakfast incur a service fee.

faqPage.question: What is special about the elevators?
faqPage.answer: Many of the elevators on Radiance of the Seas are glass and face the outside of the ship, providing scenic ocean views as you move between decks.

faqPage.question: Does the soda package work at all bars?
faqPage.answer: If you have the refreshment package, you will get a souvenir cup. While there are no Freestyle machines, any bartender can get you a soda. They will see the package on your SeaPass card, so you don't always need the cup with you.
